name: Sri Banashankari Donne Biriyani
reviews_list:
[('Rated 1.0', "RATED
  Don't ever order in this restaurant. Worst Mutton Biryani that we have eaten in years. Briyani made with looks like Govt Ration broken rice, can't call it mutton biriyani but special bone & fat biryani. Only bones no flesh, raitha was onion with water and watery gravy.
Tried calling the restaurant to give a mouthful but nobody picked the call."), ('Rated 1.0', 'RATED
  Taste was good however only one small piece and a bone Mutton for 180 rupees. Disappointed with the Mutton quantity. Packaging and gravy, Raitha was good.'), ('Rated 1.0', "RATED
  Worst biriyani.... Sorry is not biriyani just jeera rice.... I never eat this type of worst biriyani in my life....it's true.. if u don't believe just order food,eat ones then only you know i say truth...finally don't waste money and time. Thanks..."), ('Rated 1.0', "RATED
  Ordered Donne Chicken Biriyani - I haven't eaten anything tasteless than this. Even plain white rice would have tasted better. My platter looked like a bunch of misplaced rice dumpling had a roller coaster ride on the grasses in the morning & came home tired in the afternoon! Well they also managed to bring a crow's fleshy tail (if it exists). A single piece of chicken, the synonymous of Kauwa Biriyani!"), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  Food was good.. we ordered the mutton biryani meal!! Quantity of biryani was good.. others were barely less than stater's.. but very tasty... They must include raita.. as food is too heavy.. just one problem is in description it says egg.. but did not receive it.."), ('Rated 2.0', 'RATED
  In chicken thali ragi ball was not available, they should include all items what they show in the menu. This is kind of cheating only. next time onwards if u canÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82ÃÂ¢Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x80Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x99t cover all the shown item in thali then remove those items from d menu.'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  Expected a good good taste but it was an average !!! and chicken pieces in biriyani was not fully cooked and it was half cooked! and kshatriya kebab was horrible!!'), ('Rated 2.0', 'RATED
  not good...food was cold...n we had ordered for kebab...which was full of just bones..'), ('Rated 2.0', 'RATED
  Biriyani was fine. Leg soup was a disaster. Water has been added much later after preparation to make up the quantity. It was bad. We would not order again'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED

name: Royal Restaurant
reviews_list:
[('Rated 1.0', 'RATED
  Order was declined after payment went thru because there were no agents to deliver. They should not have accepted order if they know they cannot deliver. The refund process is a big headache. Worst experience'), ('Rated 3.0', "RATED
  The place is not meant for those gourmet and extravagant experiences. The ambience and hygiene would need a compromise but certainly your taste buds will not. We ordered half tandoori chicken and half chicken majestic, and portions were giant to quench the hunger of two famished guys. The wheat paratha was also huge and the best bread option. name: Bangaliana

name: Eagles Pizza
reviews_list: [('Rated 5.0', 'RATED\n  The place is right next to petrol pump and they have enough room to park 2 wheelers. Its a well arranged place with ample seats and good ambience. Cleanliness is maintained and their outlet decoration is quite interesting. There are also games available here to spend time while they prepare your order. They have an offer going on of 1 on 1 free pizza and i had especially come here for that. Ordered a Caribbean chicken pizza and 1 took another chicken pizza for the free one. It was delicious with lots of toppings and cheese. Absolutely worth every buck.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED\n  From the name itself it reflects that this place has an eagles view in point of serving pizzas which relish the taste buds. We ordered for veg fiesta with cheese burst and it turned to be very delicious. The ambience is okay. This place is situated right next to Koramangala Social and is adjacent to the main road. One can easily find this place. Would recommend this place for a perfectly delicious quick snack bite.')]

name: Spice It - Ibis Hotel

reviews_list:
[('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  On my visit to bangalore, stayed in Ibis hosur road for two days and did breakfast in Spice It.

name: Chung Shan Chinese Restaurant
reviews_list:
[('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Went here Many times!! I love there Each and every dishes....Its a Small Restaurant, The Ambiance is though little conjusted but simple with elegant decor..
They really do serve yummy dishes....They prepare authentically and serve enough with the quantity...
Menu is Good and has lot to explore..
The cost of the menu is reasonable..
Staff are courteous too with their quick service...
Thank You so much ...????
Guyz if you are looking for authentic Chinese Dishes in reasonable price, then this is the place
I would like to recommend ....'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  A small place with a decent ambiance as compared to the restaurants in it's vicinity. Good quantity and quality on the food. I had nothing to complain about this outlet. The area where it placed is loud and busy, not exactly fine dining. However, the take-away's are a must try."), ('Rated 1.0', "RATED
  I used to be a regular customer of this restaurant. Recently I tried placing an order for a soup, a starter and momos.   Ordered food yesterday.. used for noodles and fried rice, but now the taste is not great, quality is getting to worse. American choupsey not up to the mark.. crispy noodles not served they way it has to be.'), ('Rated 5.0', "RATED
  Owesome food. Specialy the thukpa. Coming back for sure. Great experience out here. Must give more than 5 if i could. We enjoy anytime we came here. So pupil i wanna suggest to you, if you're looking for a best and cheap restaurant, go to this chung shan chinese &mom."), ('Rated 4.5', "RATED

  The worst place to order from. I stay right at the main road and the delivery boys could not find the house after 10 calls and 20 minutes. Then they said "cancel the order" wow!'), ('Rated 5.0', "RATED
  I have gone crazy after having Chinese at this particular restaurant pinned at a busy road in Ejipura. After passing by this place, finally thought of giving it a try.   A good place to have momos and north eastern food. The good thing about the place is the price range, its cheap and good. A perfect pocket friendly option for food lover's. I specially liked the Chicken Momos and Chicken Items.

Ambiance - 2.5/5

  Best momos in the area. The chicken momos are my favorite. And the pork thukpa. They are about to start making egg gravies too. The restaurant is small and with friendly staff.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  This has been one of my favorite restaurant/diner in bangalore since I came here a year ago.As a foreigner with biased interest in food (japanese, chinese and korean cuisines)..(although its not really fully chinese).. I can say that this restaurant has the consistency with good food well worth the value you have to pay. The food here is great and affordable and simple whilst very good at the same time.   Corner House is my go to place for those sinful sweet cravings!
The legendary DBC needs no introduction!
The chocolate cake used in it is by far one of the best I've had. Ice cream, dryfruits, cream and cake are literally smothered by that hot chocolate!
It's a delight to see the person pour liquid hot chocolate generously on the DBC and it always makes me jump like a kid."), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Visited this place along with my friends... I ordered two scoops of butterscotch ice cream...

Ice cream quality :-> 5/5
Ambiance :-> 3.5/5
Decor :-> 4/5
Service :-> 4/5'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Became our favourite stop for ice creams and shakes. The quality and quantity are simply awesome. Must try all their thick shakes...

Caution !! Visiting here has been proven addictive....'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  Had tried cake-a-mocha, dbc and cake fudge all were so good and never disappointed by corner House the quantity is so good it'll fill your stomach."), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  It is a decent place with good ice cream collection. They have a neat and clean outlet. The delivery experience has been good although the ice cream tends to melt by the time it reaches the customer. It is because of the way they prepare the ice cream. Better to have it in the store! Cheers!')]

name: Savoury Restaurant
cuisines: Arabian, North Indian, Chinese, Fast Food
reviews_list:
[('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  my review 11th january 2019 dinner.

On the way to room from lalabag... thirst and hunger rushed us to savoury.even we had bad experience for lunch at another
branch of savoury there was no doubt for us to choose this branch coz we love their food and its must visit place for me whenever i come to banglore.our freind also joined us...parking available at frontage itself.. there was a heavy crowd infront of the restaurant. heard that longroute bus stops here and it was a friday night.ordered soups ,bbq fish, green salad poraatta appam mutton stew and bamboo biriyani....savoury maintained their taste for almost dishes.i liked appam and stew and bbq fish.bamboo biriyani rices i felt like over boiled and rice was too small.overall good experience.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  We visited savoury Madiwala yesterday evening. Ambience is very much good. Service was also excellent. We had chicken shawarma and Thalassery chicken biriyani. Shawarma was good. Biriyani was not that much great. Rice has flavour but the chicken was overfried inside it and missing authentic taste.'), ('Rated 3.0', "RATED
  The chicken was undercooked. It was a home delivery and I don't know what went wrong. But I usually find the food good and never had any issues. But there was no way I could return the food. So yeah."), ('Rated 3.0', "RATED
  Got a good feedback on their shawarma. They didn't have it for lunch. The mutton briyani felt a little oily while the grilled chicken was too dry and stringy. The lassi was too thick and the service was fast but shoddy."), ('Rated 5.0', "RATED
  One of the big ones in this area, their menu is wide and tasty, hygiene and customer service is just extra ordinary.
Don't confuse it with the adjacent sea shell restaurant."), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  This the best place to go to for a quick meal. Especially if you are boarding one of those buses heading out of the state. But be prepared to wait for seating especially if you are a large number!
Our standard orders include the Lebanese Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x93do-it-yourselfÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x94 shawarma and the al faham. They never disappoint.
The royal falooda was a let down. The coconut milkshake was just about OK.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Typical thalassery biriyani and kearala meals at a normal price it was very tasty the service was good. The restaurant is well maintained lot of crowed was there coz its sunday afternoon over all 4/5.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Prominently located after the Madivala underpass, parking may be a problem here because of long distance buses stopping & starting continuously in front of the entrance, even as they have courteous staffs providing valet parking service.
The restaurant has comparatively conveniently priced items & a wide variety from Mughlai, Arabian, Kerala & Mangalore style sea foods.
I have found the Reshmi Kabab & Bamboo Biryani specially interesting. There are a lot of exciting Arabian variety to try for the sake of novelty if not anything else.
Service is friendly & decent . Tag : Nikhat Firdose'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  This chain has the best Arabian & Malabar cuisine my favourite includes alfaham, Shawarma, appam, puttu & kadala curry. Price is reasonable for the delicious dish they serve.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  A Prime Location restaurant one of bigger size in Madiwala on Bus stand.

It serves North n South Indian. Visited this place being odd time had only lime juice.

The service was excellent n taste was good as well the rates are cheap'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Ordered Mango fish curry, fish tawa fry, alfham chicken, butter chicken, rotis and ghee rice. All tasted really good and worth. It is a multi cuisine restaurant. Ambience was decent along with the seating arrangements.')]

name: Indus Family Restaurant
reviews_list:
[('Rated 1.0', 'RATED
  The food is not that great, chicken was not that tasty, the rice was ok, vegetarian starters and main course were not properly cooked, the staff is pretty unprofessional.. they take more than 30 mins to get Ur order...not recommended'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  This review based on online order. If you visit and have dinner there ,it might be better,fresh and hot .
We ordered north veg thali .It comprised of rice ,tandoori roti(1), panner butter masala(5-6 pieces),Dal (yellow), baby corn (65),onion salad and papad. everything was fine but tandoori roti was hard ,however you cannot expect it to be when you order and is received without aluminium foil. I felt the babycorn was more red coloured(artificial).

Quantity: 5/5 enough for one person
Taste: 3.5/5
packaging:3/5')]

name: Momo Junction
reviews_list:
[('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Momo Junction, is a one-stop place for momo lovers. I was craving for momo, and had from Momo Junction; a good spread of chicken momo.. I loved them thoroughly.

The price they charge for 8 piece of momos, is worth it.. Fried chicken momos were out of the world. It was crispy, juicy, and yummy. Perfect fried momos. Hope they maintain that quality for time to come.. ??

Steamed chicken momos were tasty too. They were small in sizes but perfect for the price they charge.

Just keep up the great work.. Loved your momos. The red sause was complementing the momos perfectly. .. ??

I came across few reviews in the page, people cursing MOMO Junction for not delivering with mayonnaise. I mean seriously, who eats momos with mayonnaise..?? it tastes good with red firey sauce..??

Please keep up the good work..??

Happy ordering guy!! ????')]

name: Ooty Chocolates
reviews_list: [('Rated 4.0', 'RATED\n  A must try for a huge variety of home made chocolate. Loved it so much that I ended up buying almost half the varieties on offer. Easy on the sugar level and well priced')]

name: Liveat
reviews_list:
[('Rated 1.0', "RATED
  I was really happy to see a vegan menu. I ordered a peanut tofu rice from Uber Eats. The stuff that showed up had no salt and it was filled with whitish stones. Literally every bite had at least two small stones. I had left a review on Uber Eats but they didn't bother to respond. No wonder that was the last thing I ate from there."), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  This is the first time I am trying the food. It is great to see a nice vegan menu. I ordered the avocado pesto pasta. I liked the sauce. But I think there was no/low salt - maybe because of health reasons. So I added it. You could also add more veggies into the pasta - good for health and tastes yum! And a little more portion maybe :)'), ('Rated 1.0', 'RATED
  Very bad!! DonÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92t try'), ('Rated 2.0', 'RATED

  That was the worst quinoa pancake IÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92ve ever tasted. IÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92d really like refund for that as I threw it straight in the garbage. The zucchini boat was not bad.'), ('Rated 1.0', 'RATED
  Ordered their roasted broccoli with feta cheese. It was filled with lettuce and barely 5 small pieces of cheese. For veg keto, the main source of fat is cheese and it was extremely disappointing. To make it worse, had stomach upset within an hour of having lunch.'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  Great options for Healthy food. They have separate sections for #Vegan #Keto #Glutenfree etc.. so for someone looking for something specific, they've done a good job in categorinzing their food types.
The food is pretty good. They use good quality ingredients and dish out some tasty fare - even though it's health specific.
quantity of couple dishes I ordered could be a bit more.

good job."), ('Rated 5.0', "RATED
  The Buddha Bowl is a perfect balance of health and taste. The portion size is generous. Everything in the bowl is hot so the lettuce got soggy, but the rest of it is amazing.

The strawberry and chia seed pudding is a surprise. It's not as sweet as a dessert but it tastes like one. My overall experience of Liveat is one of the best among the food joints serving healthy food.

P.S. - The nutritional value of the dishes on menu is really helpful in deciding what to order."), ('Rated 4.5', 'RATED
  Customer delight points : ordered a Chia seed drink. Got the wrong one. Mistakes happen. however what happened next was unexpected. not only was the order replaced with the correct one. also got a complementary chia seed pudding which by the way was out of thr world. Would have given a five on five but feel that thr hummus with veggie sticks could have been priced lower as quantity was a lil less and the taste could be better.

All the best team Liveat. looking forward to give a five on five on the next order.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  I had a buddha bowl and absolutely loved it. It was healthy and yet so tasty which was very satisfying. The quantity is brilliant and the food being vegan beats it all! Also, I really liked that the nutrient proportions are specified for every dish making it convenient for anyone to keep a track of their macros. 

Glad I have a go-to place for the vegan and health conscious self in me!'), ('Rated 5.0', "RATED
  I am not a vegetarian but I always wanted to eat hummus. I must say it was extremely tasty. I am afraid l liked it so much, I can't order different items from Liveat's wide range of items!"), ('Rated 3.5', 'RATED
  Tasty and healthy vegetarian food. I asked for a substitution however, and food came without regard to it.

  Yum yum yum! Tasty and super healthy. Weekends made easy. :) thank you liveat for being everyoneÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92s guilt free pleasure! I had the cheese mushroom Dish and didnÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92t feel bad about having the cheese! So much protein as well! ?'), ('Rated 4.5', 'RATED
  Very innovative, healthy dish. Loved the beet root spinach quesedilla. Yummy + healthy. Just 1 improvement area: the wheat roti base was too dry.'), ('Rated 5.0', "RATED
  I found the place while I was on a diet looking for something that would suit the diet plan. Ordered the zucchini rolls and since then have been in love with the food here. It's the perfect blend of tasty and healthy. It's an absolutely brilliant combination of menu as well.
And yes I do recommend very strongly that you have the zucchini rolls (with mushroom) once atleast because they are just amazing!"), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Had ordered grilled paneer with pesto! They deliver quick and seem to have decent options of Keto options. The portions might look small but they are quite filling, trust me :) Good place to order from!'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  Ordered Palak Tofu & Quinoa Pilaf which was really nice and best part was it was hot when I got it.
Generous amount of tofu which I got and there was equal amount of Pilaf and Palak Tofu ( both in 500 ml container ).
You can feel it was light and yummy if you are particular about reducing carb intake.

I had also ordered Iced Cofee Protein Shake but I don't think it's worth ( it was warm .. but coz it was kept with my Hot food but duh ?... )

Will be trying something else tomorrow as well from their menu."), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  There are very few places I can order from that completely understand the concept of a vegan diet. I was excited just by seeing the number of vegan friendly options here! Food delivered was still hot and fresh by the time it reached me.

Though their focus is on health and macros for what I ate fit in perfectly with my (fat loss) diet plan, the food was unbelievably tasty! Must try when you want a tasty+ healthy all in one bowl.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED

name: Scottish Pub
reviews_list:
[('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  This is a great place for drinking wine and chilling with friends. We ordered plenty of chicken dishes to complement our beer.
We ordered their homemade wine which had a nice sweet flavour. The Cheese Cherry Pineapple was the icing on the cake which complemented the wine beautifully. A must visit in Bangalore !'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Wine with cheese and pineapple had been the best and my favourite when I visit here. Place has been there for years now . Parking becomes an issue though. Go with least expectations otherwise')]

name: Soda Bottle Opener Wala
reviews_list:
[('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Tried the chicken Sanju baba and the mutton seekh kebab paratha as the main course and the paneer croquettes for starters . The paneer croquettes were average. Although the mutton seekh kebab was a delight to have . In desserts tried the mawa cake with ice cream. It was fresh, fluffy and a delight to the taste buds.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  This is one of the amazing breakfast place in Bangalore. Old style with a modern touch. Managed by Olive Group. It is a Irani cafe serving Parsi and Bombay-inspired dishes. It is sure to take you back in time with the vintage theme and style. We went for weekend breakfast ordered Raasta Sandwich, Bun Omlete, Chicken Cutlet Pav, Poori Bhaaji, Khari Buscuit and Irani Biscuit is a must try. Irani chai is yum and special. A must for chai lovers. The freshness, unique tatse and wholesomeness of the dishes kinds of makes your meal special. The hospitality is all with friendly faces and quick service. Seating and ambiance sort of reminds you of Bombay local cafes with that buzziness yet smoothness. A bit on a pricer side but worth the experience.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Much awaited place and the wait was a worth. Too good ambience and amazing staff with delicious food makes a restaurant shine like a ?. I loved this place has everything what i need to have for a good time and the karaoke night just was cherry on top of the cake. Highly recommend...'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  Soda Bottle Opener Wala is a place that will remind one off the quintessential Parsi cafes, with portraits of Bawas hanging on the wall and old songs playing on the back ground !
Very happy atmosphere and sweet staff.
Tried out the berry pulao (basmati rice cooked with vegetables and topped up with nuts and berries ) and the seakanji ( princes and jaggery topped up with lemonade and mint) . The drink was a bit too sweet for my likings and I couldn?t finish the whole thing.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  The finest Parsi cafe in town with dim lights and low profile ambience. Sanju Baba and Salli Chicken are prepared to its finest and they also have many Bombay dishes which are served with pav. The service is quick but the price is little high.'), ('Rated 3.0', "RATED
  With a touch of Parsi not entirely a delightful experience. Although I appreciate the fact that they support the community with their employment for pyshically disabled people. The food is not so great. Wouldn't recommend."), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  I?ve eaten a few times at SBOW, but after having veg Parsi food in Bombay, I realized how unique it was to Bangalore.

My breakfast consisted of the 100% vegetarian Poro, which reminded me of the Tomato ?Omelette? that?s popular in vegetarian households. I was a bit nervous to try the next one, a vegetarian version of the Navsari French Toast. It passed muster. I had a sugarcane juice at the beginning, and ended my breakfast with Parsi chai which was super. Kudos to the team for offering so many vegetarian options of Parsi food!

A very contemporary ambiance and menu. Friendly service. All these make SWOB a very nice place to visit. I need to come back and try more options from the menu.'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  This was my first visit to the place and it did not disappoint .. it has that original Mumbai parsi feeling but with a mordern touch to it.
Food was yummy and reasonably priced but the music was too loud, considering that it's supposed to be a place for a great conversation. Would recommend trying this place out at least once"), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  A group of friends visited this place and we were hungry... I found out this place to experience the food. We had Vada Pav, Kand Bhujiya, authentic Bhel puri and Irani Chai. Ambience and aroma was nice, waiters are polite and friendly.'), ('Rated 3.0', "RATED
  Good ambience, great music. Crowd is decent, good family place. Starter and bites includes lots of interesting stuff, different kinda pav combinations, street snacks and bites to choose from. I had cheese sev puri which was great.

Mains, straight away order muttun berry pulou, good quantity and great taste 'must try' than followed up with chicken dhansak, good.

Parsi Prawn curry and veg curry, portion was less and not worth ordering.

Dessert we had bombay kulfi and mawa cake with ice cream.

One star less for less attentive stuff and one for small table, its very difficult when thiers too many plates on the table. Few changes and people can have a comfortable space to eat and enjoy."), ('Rated 5.0', "RATED
  If only I could give 6 stars, I would have given it. This place is a legend in its own sense. It is one of those places where no matter how many times you have been, still don't fail to amaze you. 

Food - 5/5 (be ready to gain a couple of pounds by the time you leave this place)
Drinks - 5/5 (good drinks to order)
Ambiance - 5/5 (Styled after old days Mumbai, retro look. They play old Hindi movie songs of the 70s and 80s)
Location - 5/5 (parking is an issue, otherwise the place is located very next to UB City)
Service - 5/5 (friendly staff. If you are ordering more than required, they recommend you to cut down some of the food items)
Value for money - 5/5

  WHAT HAPPENED TO SODABOTTLEOPENERWALA???!!

I returned to this lovely restaurant after a gap of almost 2 years to find so much of the lovely thought missing. From the little train that chugs no more, to the mithai counter with all the sugar sweets that looked haphazard, the berry pulao and dhansak that were earlier served from a multilevel tiffin dabba to the bill which arrived without a familiar plate of toffees.
They were touches that made a visit to SODABOTTLEOPENERWALA different and in my case precisely what made it memorable.
I?m knocking off a star for all those missing touches.

The food was wonderful as usual and the staff was courteous and lovable.
NOTE: They?ve hired a few hearing impaired waiters which I find to be a very progressive and noteworthy development. Kudos!'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  AMBIENCE 5/5- The ambience is great and their choice of music was too good. Old hindi songs

RASPBERRY SODA and KALA KHATTA SODA- if you like fruity flavours then go for the raspberry one, they blend real raspberrys not just flavour syrup.

KEEMA PAV- this was the best out of all the dishes we ordered, however the quantity was less.

Ordered some mutton cutlet which was satisfactory and a popular rice dish in the end , which consisted of rice and sweet gravy chicken and i did not like it at all.

--------------------
If you want a taste of parsi cuisine do try this place, but not sure that everyone will like it.'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  The ambience of this place is lovely. At the entrance was a deaf and dumb girl who greeted us with a huge smile on her face. She pointed to her book to tell us how long to wait and she also wished us a happy new year by pointing at her book.

It's lovely that more restaurants are hiring physically challenged people. It sets a ground to a progressive future.

The food wasn't very enjoyable, the Chicken Shalli was just tomatoes with chicken with a side of Pav. I do want to go back here and try the other dishes though."), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Best food and they?re helping deaf people by letting them work in there, which is really nice initiative. Hopefully more restaurants adopt same and help the needy'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED

  The highlight of this place is their staff. They are very sweet and respectful and definitely prompt too. Though it's a small place to hangout, the decor and ambiance is nice..like a typical Irani cafe that you will find in Bombay, to which they have added their touch.

  Soda Bottle Opener Wala has been one of my most favourite restaurants. I am in love with the entire Parsi vibe of the place. I have visited most of their outlets in Mumbai but recently visited their Bangalore outlet and I must say the feel of the place is exactly the same. They serve phenomenal Kaanda Bhajia. Pair it with Irani Chai and you are sorted. Other favorites from the menu are Berry Pulao, Bharuchi Paneer Akuri, 5 star Brownie and Bombay style Vada pav. Order anything from the menu and you won't be disappointed."), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Live Retro Music and Parsi Breakfast!! Perfect start to your Sunday;))
Went there after my jog at Cubbon Park, nice cozy place with vast menu and friendly service. Surely a must visit'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  On a cold Saturday night, we thought to try a new cuisine. After exploring a lot on Zomato, we decided to try Parsi cuisine at Soda Bottle Opener Wala, that was on our must try list for quite long time.
Ambiance: First thing that strikes you will be 70s and 80s era bollywood songs played out loud. You instantly get into jovial mood. Nicely decorated retro theme.
Food & Drinks: We started with on-house Kokum soda and Rice chips. Both were good. Then we ordered Chicken Farcha that was served with fries and green chutney. Excellent preparation. Next we ordered was Bohri Mutton Keema Pav. Finger licking delicious. Finally, it was time for Berry Mutton Pulav - awesome. In drinks we ordered Kaala Khatta Soda - brilliant.
Service: Excellent.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  This place gives all the perfect Bombay vibes. The ambience have a lot of thought put into them. The same applies to the way they serve the food. Keema Pav is a must have.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  3.5 for the food. 0.5 for the awesome act of hiring deaf and mute people.

Now the food: it?s good, it?s an experience but the menu doesn?t really do well together. They are trying to be a Irani cafe with a bar and some innovation. Be a Irani cafe please. And have a lunch menu and a dinner menu. Irani Chai with Bohri keema pav goes well for evening snacks.

That said ... it?s good tasting food. The basics such as Dhansak were really good but the pav still needs to be warm. The prawns are good and the malai parantha is special.'), ('Rated 5.0', "RATED

  What an amazing amazing place. Old Bombay charm recreated and a total lovable Bawa place. Right from the 70s music to the decor, it is a lovable Bawa place to the core. Very friendly nice and smiling servers. Loved the friendly vibes.
The food and drinks were lip smacking- now when have Parsi joints ever gone wrong with food.
We ordered The Chicken Pav Cutlet and Tareli Macchi to go with our cocktails- a normal gin tonic( finding frenny) and a raspberry vodka.
Perfectly cooked and succulent.
Then came the main course- had to be the typical Dhansaak (mutton) and the Berry Pulao Chicken. Both were satisfying and reminded me so much of my Bombay days.
A huge shoutout to you guys at SodaBottleOpenerWala . You guys Rock !!'), ('Rated 5.0', "RATED
  If you're missing the vibe of most of the places of Kamala Mills, Mumbai, SodaBottleOpenerWala is the place to be. The food itself is delicious. But the ambience is what keeps you hooked. We had ordered mutton salli boti (absolutely delicious, by the way), prawn masala (was ok, not too much, but), cheesecake (delicious), chai and kala khatta cola! The salli boti and cola were totally worth going back for! The service is super quick and definitely the vibe is awesome. A little piece of Bombay tucked in a beautiful part of Bangalore!"), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Apart from the food and music nothing less was good about this place. The seating was uncomfortable, the place was conjusted, over crowded and too noisy.'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  The best Parsi restaurant in town! The ambience is amazing and welcoming, with the place we'll decorated with antique pieces. Tried the Salli Chicken, which includes chicken curry and 2 Pav. The chicken curry was delicious, with the gravy having the sev and tomatoes in it. Also tried the Dhansak chicken. This comes in a beautiful steel tiffin carrier, reminding you of those good old days. For a drink, we tried the sekanje bean, which had a piece of ornage on top, with tamarind and leaves. The sweet drink went very well with the main course. The service was very friendly, although the food took some time to arrive. Overall, an amazing place for Parsi food!"), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED

  If you wanna try something different and have different experience go to this restaurant
It?s not like normal restaurant which serves alcohol
It?s completely North Indian themed restaurant
Service is good
God place to hangout with families'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Soda bottle opener wala had captured my interest while I was in US. Being a Bombay person I was also excited to eat Bombay street food and Irani cafe food in Bangalore!
I was not only impressed by the food and service but I was also awed by their initiative on supporting the specially abled people! I wish other restaurants could follow suit !

Detailed Rating

1) Food - 10/10 taste is sec ond to none
2) Ambience - 8/10 too much of old Bombay charm but in a good way
3) Social Quotient - 10/10 the people they employ are special people and I think a lot of restaurants should learn from this joint
4) Service - 10/10
5) Music - 10/10
6) Presentation- 10/10 retaining the dabba culture wow!!

Recommended
1) Berry Pulao
2) Cheese Pav
3) Keema Pav
4) Baida Roti'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Love the food.. love the place.. very vibrant and colorful.. good service..

Ofcourse the raspberry soda. ?????'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED

  Sodabottleopenerwala is a perfect place to reach for some good retro music along with the some awesome cocktails. The Ambience over here is the perfect to revive your memories of old Bombay. The music goes perfect with the ambience old retro music and a old Bombay feel is the best experience ever. It will make you feel like your in to olden times restaurant. On the screen they also keep playing some of the funny clips  which will make you laugh.

As being in Bangalore and experiencing the old Bombay is a gem in Bangalore.

Bombay chat house special menu -

Seabuckthorn Ragda pani puri
Sev puri cheese puri
Puffed amarnath lotus seed bhel
Ragda and banana pattice
Pav bhaji with goat cheese

Coctails and moctails -

Rasberry beer
Rustum bantwala
Finding frenny
The bumsuckerwala

Coming to Service - A special thanks to Gopal for the amazing service and hospitality'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Food- 4/5

Decor-3.5/5

  SodaBottleOpenerWala situated at the Lavelle road opposite to the Harley Davidson showroom, It is a parsee themed place, They introduced a new menu Bombay chaat House that includes all chats, pavbhaji and pattice its unique menu with street taste.

We visited on weekend they have the comfort seating with retro music

Coctails and moctails we had:

-Rasberry beer: A mix of raspberry in the beer.

-Rustum bantwala: They have served in the goli soda bottle.

-Finding frenny.

-The bumsuckerwala.

Bombay chat house special menu:

-Seabuckthorn Ragda pani puri.

-Sev puri cheese puri.

-Puffed amarnath lotus seed bhel.

-Ragda and banana pattice.

-Pav bhaji with goat cheese.

Service- A special thanks to Gopal for the amazing service.

Overall soda bottle opener wala is a must visit place.

Foodstopbengaluru ratings :

Food :- 5/5.

Service :- 5/5.

Ambience :- 5/5

For more recommendations In bangalore, you can follow our page @foodstopbengaluru on instagram/ Facebook / Zomato'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  This is my first visit to try some Parsi food and this place is just right. The staff were very friendly polite, helpful and loved the way they presented their food. Special thank to Mr. Jhantu he help us a lot. Food was amazing and drinks as well.
They dimmed the lights creating a vivid oldish environment. It was so comfortable and the decor makes you amazing dining here.
Thank you so much sodabottleopenerwala for your such a great hospitality.
Thanks again to Mr JHANTU he made us happy.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Great food!Great drinks!Great service!Great Ambience!
Definitely worth visiting. They?ve some amazing Parsee food and some brilliant cocktails. We tried their prawn and brinjal patio , Mutton chops and their special cocktails (Bantawala is amazing).
Very happy with the overall experience ?'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  A unique menu - more like street food made tastier and classy . Nice old style cafe like ambience and cute cutleries .Its a small place and we went for dinner.Tried their bhoriekheema Pav and chicken baida roti - they were absolutely yummy !!Tried the mushroom chicken soup and it was good too . Also tried chilly chicken cheese Pav and chicken Pav which were just ok . Tried Malwa cake which was good too n Shrewsbury biscuit was not good .
The place is expensive and the food is really light too to fill your stomach . I wish they increase quantity .
Overall a yummy snacker place perfect for evening chai n snacks or pre lunch . Food is expensive but tasty with unique varieties . Would definitely like to revisit n try few more options .'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED

  Visited the outlet in Mumbai, so decided to give it a try in bangalore when we heard about the new Bombay Chat House Special menu. Went on Saturday Night, turned out to be the retro night which completely set the mood. Located at Lavelle Road, Bangalore. The same taste is maintained Through out. The old vintage look, comfy seating & some retro music. 

What we had

-Pav bhaji with goat's cheese

-Ragada and banana pattice

-Puffed amaranth and lotus seed bhel

-The soda bottle opener Wala SPCP

-Seabuckethorn Ragada

All the chats, didnt disappointed at all. Went perfectly with the cocktails as the bar nibbles.

In cocktails, we went for the signature cocktails Raspberry Beer & Rustum Bantawala were the star of the evening

Service- Our attendant was Zhantu. A special thanks to him for the amazing service he provided."), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  Have been waiting to visit this place for way too long. Decided to catch up with friends in sunday lunch and paid a visit to this place. Options for vegetarians are a bit limited but the way they have designed the menu is worth appreciation. Don't miss out to try out their desserts. It's classic.

Ambiance- 4/5
Food- 4/5
Cost- 4/5
Service- 4/5

  Would rate it 3.5. Well, yeah i found it to be jazzy, nice ambiance but food i ordered was just fine. Pav bhaji, okra thing, soup, cranberry juice, bhel etc. well soup was nice actually, rest all were okay. I think taste can be worked upon. Service was good!
U can visit once and see whats the noise about. Maybe we ordered weird dishes at dinner time but this is what i feel ;)'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Situated close to the Biere club on Lavelle Road, SodaBottleOpenerwala is one stop shop for amazing parsi food. Right from the ambience of a parsi neighborhood to the lip smacking food, everything is amazing about this place. The staff is also very friendly and the service is also good. We ordered dhansak, breach candy awesome okra, parsi style vegetable Curry and akhuri. Every dish was perfectly cooked and served. Would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for some good parsi food.'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  Having heard so much about the ever famous Soda Bottle Opener Wala in Bombay, I finally got the chance to try out the place in Bengaluru. Curators of amazing Parsi dishes, the food here was lip smacking. We tried their Kheema Pav and the Dhansak - traditional parsi dishes, and weren't let down. The highlight for me however was the Phatelli Coffee- that was so creamy and rich in flavour. We also tried a couple of there drinks, and their kokum soda as well. The bustling ambience and attention to every small detail, be it the decor, the attractive books on the table, tell crockery, and the music simply added to the brilliant experience here. Not to mention, the service here was great, and Mr. Gopal, who had extensive knowledge of the dishes, helped us picking out dishes as well - kudos to him. The cost for two is around 1200, and definitely worth the dining experience at SodaBottle.

  Sodabottleopenerwala is very popular chain for parsi food also servicing a medley of Iraniand Mumbai dishes.
If you want to try parsi cusine ,i will definately recommend this vintage Irani cafe.
We had-
Salli chicken
Mutton dhansak
Caramel custard

These three are most famous dishes of parsi cuisine.I absolutely loved salli chicken and custard,Dhansak was also nummy but as per me other two were great.
As per me Dhansak is very unusual dish and many people may not like it, but if you actually want to try parsi food- Do try Dhansak.
And last but not the least,how can we miss caramel custard,it was perfect with not so sweet in palate and very light in tummy.
I heard somewhere that you CAN NOT end parsi food without caramel custard.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  We went to this Parsi food place last week... I was quite impressed with the typical Parsi look and feel...
The restaurant is supporting lot of guys with hearing or speech impairment...
Their service is excellent... And are very attentive... For that I would thank then and wish them all the best... This is very novel initiative...

Coming back to food we ordered chicken Frechaza which was served in hindalium Tiffin box...

The mutton was awesome so was the chicken that my wife ordered ..
The restaurant was hustling even at 3 pm on a Thursday afternoon...

Here my ratings

1. Ambiance - 4/5
2. Service - 5/5
3. Food - 4/5'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  Visited this place today morning for breakfast.
It's very easy to locate, right opposite the Harley Davidson showroom.
The place has such a beautiful ambience and the inside is absolutely beautiful with such an old-timey feel to it.
We started off by ordering 2 cold brews, one hazelnut and one with Mandarin and star anise. The presentation of both the coffees were absolutely breathtaking. The hazelnut one was quite good, the star anise one was definitely difficult to drink, it tasted bad imo.
Next we tried the herby poro, absolutely delicious. We ordered for the berry-mint pancakes and the espresso pancakes but sadly the espresso pancakes weren't available so I went in for the caramel- banana ones, now personally I liked the banana pancakes more since I dislike mint and there was a lot of it in the berry pancake dish, even though the pancakes were delicious the quantity was way too small. Overall good experience.
Food: 3.5/5
Ambience: 5/5
Service: 4.5/5
Value for money: 3.5/5"), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  Lovely decor - dim lights, basic furniture like you'll find in any irani cafe in Bombay, 2 television screens, lots of aluminum tea kettles and wall hangings of Parsi figures.
Only ordered main course - Parsi veg curry with rice and veg berry rice. The curry is coconut based and tastes just like the curry you find in any coastal town. Berry rice was loaded with roasted cashew and black berries. I found the rice a bit undercooked. Will visit again to try their non vegetarian delicacies.
PS: They have comics on parsi characters to read"), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED

name: M Cafe - Bengaluru Marriott Hotel Whitefield
reviews_list:
[('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Whitefield Marriott is located very near to our Bangalore office. Visited M Cafe for lunch during my recent visit to Bangalore.

M Cafe is a good place to have buffet lunch with a wide spread of buffet, nice ambience and good service. We tried a lot of items in buffet and the food was fresh and tasty.

We tried soup - corn and mint soup, starters - paneer tikka, potato tokri, veg tikki, salads, hummus & pita bread, dahi vada, curd rice, pickled onions, curries - french beans dry, paneer curry, veg kofta curry, dal fry, roti, veg biryani, fried rice, live counter - kathi rolls, desserts - gajar ka halwa, cakes/pastries/tarts, barfi/laddoo, mousse etc.

Overall good food, good ambience and good service. Surely worth visiting for buffet lunch/dinner.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Among famous buffets of a hotel in whitefeild area m cafe served up some amazing ala carte lunch for me during my trip to blore. I left my order to chef Sanjay ... what came back from the kitchen was absolute perfectness! A mutton Chapli kebab which was juicy and soft with an amazing burst of flavours! Next up was one of the best shrimp risotto IÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92ve had... light with subtle flavours not drenched in cream like most of the risottos these days. The final dish was my general favourite grilled fish in lemon butter sauce which was again done up perfectly. I left happy :)'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  I would say, not up to my expectations. But wait a minute, there were some amazing things too.
I came here with my client and whole project team. We were here to relish the lunch buffet. The ambience was stunning and amazing, well its in Marriott so that had to be. The staff is very courteous and helpful. And i really loved that part. Although, when i dug in the main course i was dissatisfied. The noodles were tasteless and bland, dry, as if they were cooked yesterday. The fish was tasty. The variety of the buffet was huge. I loved every dessert especially the pastries. The rasmalai here was the best rasmalai i had ever had in my life!'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  Quality of food has gone down drastically. Had been here a couple of times in the past at that time it was good. Today was really disappointing. Options were limited and taste was not impressive.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Yet another Sunday Brunch with nothing but best culinary delight one can expect at a 5 star. The spread was lavish starting from Indian, Asian, Grilled, Salad, BBQ, Live Counters, Pasta and Pizza and so much more. And what a best way to finish your meal with a desserts, which is simply the best in town. Living up to the standard. Kudos to the staff, great service.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Had visited here for a buffet team lunch. Good ambience. Limited varities of veg and non veg food.few live counters.
Still the taste of food was quiet good. They have a huge variety in desert section than the starters.
Chicken biryani and chicken kebab was very good. The kebab will get melt in your mouth.
Had a great time.
Courteous staff, prompt service and hygienic.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Went for M cafe for lunch with my friends, We went for Buffet. starters are really awesme, live kitchen for pasta, pasta was so delicious, chinese was gr8, Dont lyk Indian food, not good, Indian dessert are gr8 taste, specially boondi. Ambience was gr8, will visit again.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED

  A quick late night dinner it was. The service was poor. Took a long time to get the attention of someone .. Had to wait and hope someone notices us to get some water or to serve food. name: Bangalore Shadi Biriyani
reviews_list: [('Rated 4.0', 'RATED\n  Want to have quick lunch, this is the place. Small place with less seating capacity. Had Kerala parotha and egg bhurji at Rs 50 . Definitely a value for money place. Hygiene is the issue though.')]

name: Skandas Veg Restaurant
reviews_list:
[('Rated 2.0', 'RATED
  No to this place. It is NOT hygienic. The chefs do not cover their heads with cap. Imagine all the residual hairs and dandruff falling into the food. Yikes!!
We ordered Kesari, plain dosa, idly vadas and tea. Taste is just okay. Chutney is good though. Tea is not worth at all. Kesari is below average. Avoid and go to nearby Sri Udupi Parkk for better experience.'), ('Rated 1.0', 'RATED
  phulka/roti/bread served was stale and microwaved..on enquiring with owner, I was told that I was lying. indulged in an argument, manager/owner did not even check the possibility of replacement,the way they treated was the worst, I hope more customers boycott this place.'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  It is a good place to have a quick bite. You can have south Indian breakfast and meals here.
North indian meals are ok. They should think of providing more variety in there menu.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Very decent place to have breakfast.
Always cleanly maintained.
Very good taste and good quantity of food and chutneys. Also, affordable price.'), ('Rated 3.5', 'RATED
  A small joint, have eaten couple of times (breakfast and tiffin) - dosa, uttapam, tea, coffee. Easy to locate, self service. Tomato chutney is good.'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  The place is ok . Its small . Especially the cash counter location is very inconvenient.

  Very bad service 30 min later they informed that masala dosa and rava onion dosa is out of stock . Except them to value customers time . I would not recommend it'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  Decent place for south indian items and prices are economical. Idli, vada, dosa items are good, have not tried anything else. Comparatively less crowded than other such restaurants near by.'), ('Rated 3.5', 'RATED
  Nice cozy place for Dosa. Tried their ghee masala dosa. It was thin n crisp with handsome potato filling. Even hot and sour veg soup was so delicious with loads of broccoli, paneer and beans. Perfect soup if you got cold. Staff are polite and fast.'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED

  This review is for their South and North Indian Thali. No vegetables in thali, first of its kind Dal Makhani in North Indian meals. There are better option for South Indian meals nearby and I thought if testing and ended up writing the review.'), ('Rated 1.5', 'RATED

  Very clean and decent restaurant. I loved eating especially ghee masala Dosa. I feel that they need to increase the varieties of food items in menu card. Filter coffee was very refreshing n yummy.')]

name: Laddoos
reviews_list:
[('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  My visit to laddoo is only for samosa, laddoo, jalebi and kachoris. They have many other things also. The price is not very reasonable but for the taste I am ready to pay anytime. The samosas, kachoiri are very fresh. They make these fresh everyday. I love everytime I went there or ordered online. '), ('Rated 2.0', "RATED
  So as usual on a festive day, I ordered few sweets and chaat from ladoos. Delivery was on time but the quality was really low. I ordered kaju roll, papdi chat, and khaman dhokla. The dhokla was the worst thing. Food color was added and didn't taste good at all. Please avoid these things from ordering."), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  This place is a good option for sweets and snacks. Its located in busy area of BTM.The items are a bit priced more than expected. But this place is a good choice in this area. Vada pav , kachori, dahi puri ,parathas are some of my favourites here. Taste and quality is good. Ambience is ok.Its better for buy and go than sit and eat here. Not very attractive ,but does not matter considering u would visit it for snacks for shorter time.'), ('Rated 2.0', 'RATED
  Let me start with good thing. Sweets are good.
Their other food items like parathas n pooris n meals aren?t good at all! Quality is too poor.
The guy who sits on counter is arrogant. Dunno how to greet people?
They have to improve a quality of food a lot better.
Their parathas are just simple parathas. None of the stuffed parathas would have any filling ?

I don?t recommend this place.'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  After a lot of hits and misses finally found a place in Bangalore, which makes authentic chats without adding carrot and stuffs like that as is normal in Bangalore. Also not just chats but the pay bhaji, chhole Bhatoore,lassi and dhokla were the dishes I tried and they were awesome.
Not exactly the same taste as of any chat shop in Delhi you will get but when compared with other outlets in Bangalore it's one of the best north Indian veg restaurant.
The laddoos in BTM is a good place to start and follow it up with some genuine North Indian dishes like sum aloo which is not sweet and the Paratha, samosa etc, ending the meal with some good malai lassi."), ('Rated 3.0', "RATED

name: The French Loaf

  This is the worst French loaf I have ever been to!! Their cakes taste disgusting (dry, crunchy, sour!) and the person working there has no idea how to write messages on cakes! He scribbled like how a young kid writes on my cake!! Worst of all, he couldn't even pack the cake properly after repeatedly telling him to pack it carefully!! He smudged the flower in the top of my cake and the top creamy layer of my cake was completely stuck on the package!!! I called to the French loaf and he didn't even respond properly.   I tried their bakery items couple of times. They are tasty. We ordered ? birthday cake here once. It was bit costly but was Yummy. The store offers quality bakery stuff as per my experience.'), ('Rated 2.0', 'RATED
  Pretty average place. Did not feel it is value for money. Understandably they have closed down. They used to be empty most of the time. I had bought cakes from here found that they were hard than I had expected. The bread had too much maida I guess, was very very soft. But the price for this was too much.'), ('Rated 1.0', "RATED
  this place really suck in the name of France..
con's: seating is bad..no coverage of the menu...dumb staff..
pros: outward structure.."), ('Rated 1.0', 'RATED
  This place sucks. Nothing outstanding about the atmosphere or food.'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  We were returning home after a moderately heavy lunch and saw this place on the way back. It was lucky that we were already on the left side and were able to park quickly just opposite this place.

It is located on the BTM main road on left side if coming from Silk Board junction. It is important to stay on the left side as it is a very busy road. Watch out for Mom & Me store. The French Loaf is just before that.

It is a very small place with just three small tables. Its main business revolves around birthday cakes of various shapes and sizes. There are various pastries, breads and other eats on display. We picked up our favourite - Eclairs and other Chocolate pastry. Both were great.

I wouldn't exactly call this place a value for money but it is a moderately good deal. I can happily give this one a 4 out of 5.

blog.husainad.com"), ('Rated 4.5', 'RATED
  Ambience: This petit place has a nice vibe to it. The shop has a European look and feel, though there is hardly any seating capacity.

Food: Everything looked quite delicious. We tried a veg sandwich combo which came with a grilled sandwich and ice tea both of which were good. Among the pastries, we tried German Nuts, Red Velvet Finger both of which were too delicious.

Service: The attendant was enthusiastic and prepared the order quickly.

Stuff I would recommend: Veg Sandwich Combo, German Nuts, Red Velvet Finger

Would love to come here again to check out other stuff.

I would give it a 4.5/5'), ('Rated 1.0', "RATED
  Taste is gud WHR there will be no prompt of delivery the order which dey take. Very very poor in taking order and after taking dey won't execute r provide tat order at the tym which was given."), ('Rated 3.5', "RATED
  Having been wowed by their Indira Nagar, I wanted to try this outlet. This one is right next to the GK Vale and Mom & Me near BTM Water Tank.

The interiors are a let down compared to the cosy-romantic standards set by the Indira Nagar outlet. The variety of pastries and other bakery items is excellent. Tried their Blueberry Doughnut, Cinnamon Sugar Doughnut, Vegetable Calzone, and the Butter Croissant. I quite like their food by now - has tasted dependable and consistent in whatever we've tried. Prices are decent. More of a takeaway joint, unlike the Indira Nagar one.")]

name: Fava Bistro

  Great place!

Ambience is one of the best in Bangalore, very nicely done.

Service was great.

Started off with crackers which were crisp and great.

Chicken Shawarma - the texture of the roll was good, the taste could have been better though. The Garlic sauce was stunning!

Mushroom, Broccoli kebab - were great and delicious.

Pita bread was very nice and soft.

Molten chocolate cake was perfect and gooey.

Dark chocolate decadance ice cream was star of the day, very nice!!

Finished off with chocolate truffles - amazing!

Overall a place not to be missed!!'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Really good food. Hummus was very well-made. The drinks had just right proportions of everything.
The menu needs more options like the fava in ubcity. Esp the yummy pastas, king prawns in appetisers etc.
Also waiting for wine options.
So a star less for just the options in the menu. Else, it was great.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  A very cute cafe which has both indoor and outside seating. Went there on a Sunday evening, they have partnered up with Zomato Gold. Even without the gold, the place is quite affordable and the food was delicious. Would surely visit this place again!'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  The instructions to the Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x93online bookerÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x94 was simple - look for a restaurant with a Zomato Gold offer. Obviously, there were many - so the Mediterranean and the finger food keywords caught our attention.
Unfortunately, the drinks were the let down. The Zomato Gold offer held good but the beer was rather disappointing. The first offered Wheat beer was the best. The St Martin Abbey Dark (roasted malt) was too sweet. And nothing remarkable about the Belgian white.
BUT, the food was superb. The lamb kebab, melon feta salad, labneh burrata, the mezzo duet and the Turkish pizza were all really outstanding. The bratwurst pork sausage was a little disappointing. The baklava was worth waiting for.
The service was quick, quiet and efficient.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED

  Started off with the baba ganoush which was the best I've had so far in Bangalore! The pita bread was tiny and we kept asking for more because it was baked to perfection and went great with the ganoush. We got Fava beans appetizer as well which was something different. Wouldn't recommend the tartlets. Pizza and pasta was delicious! Genovese pizza would recommend. Their handmade ravioli was also fabulous! Don't get me started on the desserts as everything was incredible! Lemon cheese cake was out of this world. Great place to visit, definitely great place to eat :D"), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Had been planning to try out fava in UB city forever, but never got to it. Loved the fact they opened up so close to us, and boy was the food good!! 4 of us went on a sunday afternoon, tried out a pizza, non veg mezze duet and chicken grill! Their hummus and sauces were yum, chicken beautifully cooked and the presentation a delight!! They served chocolate truffles at the end which were heavenly! The staff was nice and courteous. All in All a must visit on my list!'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  So Fava outlet in koramangala.quick service! Clean, neat ambience! Food was pretty good! Would have like my spaghetti a bit more saucy but desserts on point !!
Nice place to chill with friends or family, very courteous staff! Will definitely visit this place again!'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  The ambience of this place is so pretty and perfect. The decor is in pastel shades of grey, pink and blue and looks super cute. The service is nice. They played all your favourite childhood songs so that made the experience more indulging.
We ordered a spaghetti in red sauce topped with mushrooms. The consistency of the sauce couldve been better. The taste was nice. We also had a smoked chicken krauker sausage with mashed potatoes and veggies. This dish tasted really fresh and healthy. It had loads of vegetables. Overall, thefood was a 3.5/5.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Fava Bistro is the sister concern of the beloved Fava @UB city . The dishes served are pretty much the same serving largely Mediterranean and Turkish cuisines.
One large difference is that this outlet has restricted itself to serving just beers and beer based cocktails.
The pizzas are stellar!! And the desserts are superbly artistic.'), ('Rated 5.0', "RATED

  Had been planning to try out fava in UB city forever, but never got to it.   The ambience of this place is so pretty and perfect. The decor is in pastel shades of grey, pink and blue and looks super cute. The service is nice. They played all your favourite childhood songs so that made the experience more indulging.
We ordered a spaghetti in red sauce topped with mushrooms. The consistency of the sauce couldve been better. The taste was nice. The pizzas are stellar!! And the desserts are superbly artistic.'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  I was here for a Mediterranean Continental corporate lunch. Though services weren't as smooth as expected, probably owing to a huge number of people at once, but nevertheless it was fairly good experience.

For main course we had Millet and Black Rice Risotto and Penne Pasta in Arabiatta Sauce. The Risotto was pretty flavorful and well prepared, but the pasta wasn't so great and was too watery and mostly undercooked.

For starters they served some delicious Cottage Cheese Skewers and a Fava Special Multi Grain Salad. But overall the best dish was the Turkish dessert, if I am correct, called Baklava. I have had this dessert in the past at Turkish outlets and it was yet again delicious. While I might keep hopping in more at this place, regarded as a great outlet for Mediterranean cuisine, one must not miss out on this amazing dessert here served with Figs."), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  I was out of options to take my babe on an extra special day or romantic meal, just blindly book a table at fava for splendid food and memorable evening because this place is too modern and beautiful.
Thank you Zomato ?'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  The food and service were excellent. We had the mezze (half dozen) platter, lamb chops, and the chicken kebabs. They served us chocolate truffles at the end of our meal and we loved them.


swagataraha.wordpress.com'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  What a great place to eat at. They also gave their set two or three course menus on the weekdays, which is a great option.

  Amazing food and pleasing ambience is how I would describe this place!
The ambiance was pleasing and calm.
The food was top notch. We ordered the mushroom tarts which were literally heaven on earth. And then the cottage cheese kababs with hummus and pita bread and the mushroom and truffle oil pizza. Both were really delicious and had the right amount of spice. The presentations were brilliant. For dessert we had the chocolate fondant which was amaaaaaazing. I still am tasting it in my mouth. We had virgin sangrias too which were okayish. (The only meh part)
And the truffles they gave along with the bill tasted soo good.
Zomato gold is an added plus point.
CanÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92t wait to visit again!'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  All day dining place at kormangala ! We had a super nice food experience at fava with variety of Mediterranean cusinise on platter. Our first order was meze platter with chicken fingers , lamb mince and pita bread ,which was quite decent in taste and too good in appearance. Then it was chicken kebab which was outstanding and chicken Peri Peri with mashed potatoes and harisa dip , which was again a winner . Pizza we ordered was sweet and not as per our preference. Overall must try culinary delight and to top it up we got complementary chocolate truffles in the end.'), ('Rated 3.0', "RATED
  Earlier there was Ministry of Pizza at the same place and ambience is almost similar to the way it was. The place is setup well.
Pizzas were good, could've been better.
Liked the beer. They were running 1+1 offer on drinks. Seating arrangements are good. Service is quick and staff are friendly. Slightly expensive."), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED

  All day dining place at kormangala ! We had a super nice food experience at fava with variety of Mediterranean cusinise on platter.   Earlier there was Ministry of Pizza at the same place and ambience is almost similar to the way it was. The place is setup well.

  Amazing food and pleasing ambience is how I would describe this place!

Zomato gold is an added plus point.

  Great food. Chicken and mushroom tortellini is a must try here, also the lemon cheese cake. Tap beers are pretty good. Will visit again. Highly recommended.'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  Delivery: 3/5. Have not been to the restaurant, so cannot comment on ambience. Their delivery is a bit hit or miss, and being more consistent would be good.

But I have ordered several times and it was fairly good.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Visited Fava for lunch. We ordered the lamb chops with red wine jus and the mixed mushroom and truffle oil pizza. Liked both the dishes and the presentation of lamb chops was very good.   A rainy night, and gloomy weather.

They gave us some complimentary pita bread and we enjoyed it.

We had -
Creamy herb white sauce pasta - 4/5 (it was creamy but lacked the oomph)

Overall, a great place to sit and have some quality time. Loved the ambience.'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED

  The ambiance is quite simple with pleasing staff
I had ordered 2cheese pizza and a simple chicken wrap
The 2 cheese pizza was bland but full filling on the other hand, the wrap was perfect. I enjoyed eating it. We also got complimentary pita and cheese dip and for dessert we got mini chocolate truffle balls
On the whole I enjoyed this place'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  When we decided to go here, i didnt expect much. To my surprise i really enjoyed the food. We had their handmade pasta and grilled chicken for mains. Relished the food. The service was on point.
When it came to dessert, we had to think twice as we were full but gave it a shot anyway. On recommendation we took the chocolate tart. The plating is superb and different. It comes with coffee ice cream which you dont usually expect with a chocolate tart. All the elements on the plate went perfectly well with each other.
Will definitely visit again.'), ('Rated 3.0', "RATED
  Friendly staff... Good ambiance... Its more like a restaurant than pub... Felt like crafted beer were diluted and they weren't that strong.. And food is damn expensive - You will not get anything less than 350 rs. except for french fries and few other items."), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  The ambiance and the decor was decent... The staff was courteous and attentive...

  Tried this place for the 1st time . The overall ambience is 3.75/5 . The food 4/5 & service 3/5 (bit slow ) . They had some confusion on the 2nd Zomato Gold card , which they finally agreed .'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  The ambiance is quite simple with pleasing staff
I had ordered 2cheese pizza and a simple chicken wrap
The 2 cheese pizza was bland but full filling on the other hand, the wrap was perfect. I enjoyed eating it. We also got complimentary pita and cheese dip and for dessert we got mini chocolate truffle balls
On the whole I enjoyed this place'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  When we decided to go here, i didnt expect much. To my surprise i really enjoyed the food. We had their handmade pasta and grilled chicken for mains. Relished the food. The service was on point.
When it came to dessert, we had to think twice as we were full but gave it a shot anyway. On recommendation we took the chocolate tart. The plating is superb and different. It comes with coffee ice cream which you dont usually expect with a chocolate tart. All the elements on the plate went perfectly well with each other.
Will definitely visit again.'), ('Rated 3.0', "RATED

  Awesome place for Desserts and Pizza.

Food and Price: The chef here is on the top level. Go for Baklava, Falafal and Pizza. Price is a bit high but all worth.

Ambiance: Have both open and closed area. Not a big place.

Service: Fast. Courteous staff.

PS. They serve complimentary snacks. Worth to give it a try.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  The food was really good and the staff members were extremely courteous.
The place is calm and relaxed and there is sufficient space between tables.
But, they do need to train their reception staff better. Had called to check where they have dark beer, after getting confirmation when reached in the next 45 mins, they said the beer is unavailable. They had just Belgian white on tap.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Was here on a late Sunday night, it was just perfect weekend unwind, the warmth, the so clean n neatly set tables were the first to impress n then the food n the presentation was no less.'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  I am so exited that Fava is now in koramangala, Fava-UB city being one of my go to restaurants till now. It seems like a great place to catch up with friends over an elaborate brunch /dinner. Service is sometimes slow but the food is phenomenal.I always recommended their millet and black rice risotto or Mediterranean plate of some of the best falafel, hummus you would find in Bangalore. Their signature dessert was a major let down, I expected it to be more tangy, citrusy, hence the 3stars. Great ambience, I would recommend everyone to check this place out.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  I heard about this restaurant (Lavelle road one), but never been there. When they opened a outlet in Koramangala, I cannot stop myself to check it out. This place is known for their Mediterranean and European cuisine. The ambience was very posh and subtle with dim light and white walls will just make your mood. We had their smoked bbq chicken pizza, which was nice taste wise but I didnÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92t like the crushed. But good part is was a multigrain base pizza. The grill section you can choose saffron polenta or potato mash with grilled vegetables and your choice of sauce. And last but not the least their signature desserts The orange and chocolate fondant are must try.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED

  Visited the place on a weekday night for dinner. Friendly and courteous staff.
Well spaced out comfortable seating. Lovely interiors.
Went here thinking they serve wine, but they donÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92t. They serve beer and beer cocktails.
Had the Hummus and pita bread, the pita seemed more like chapati.
Minestrone soup veg, which was good and a huge portion.
Tried the classic chicken shawarma and Paneer roll.. both were accompanied with picked vegetables and fries. Tasty.
For dessert we had a scoop of caramel ice cream, and it was disappointing.
Prices on the higher side. DidnÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92t find the worth for my money.

  Dessert was best here .Amibance and staff were really good .just a pizza was stomach filling big,it was a thin crust though I would be happy if the pizza outer crust also be thin .'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  It was a Saturday dinner, we decided for fava bistro in koramangala, this place is perfectly placed and easily located very nice interiors and ambience, the staff were friendly but need to be much trained, this restaurant has combination of many healthy food too...
We had a lot of them
Could recommend u to visit this place'), ('Rated 3.0', "RATED
  I visited the Koramangala branch of Fava on a weekend evening. There was only the beer & beer-based cocktail menu for drinks at the time and we made our choices accordingly. We had the Prawn hummus and the bacon pizza, along with a couple of draughts and a strawberry-based beer-cocktail. 

The drinks tasted good, as did the main-course options we'd chosen. The service was super-quick and efficient, even as the decor perfectly offset the vibe with its turquoise blue and white walls and furniture. 

However, I have to point out that the portions were extremely small and disproportionate in the case of the hummus. 4 pieces of small pita & exactly 4 prawns were served with 4 large mounds of hummus. Not only is this disproportionate in the pita-to-hummus ratio, but the serving size also was terribly distasteful. If not for this, I did have a relatively decent dining experience here."), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Have passed by this place a lot of times but finally decided to visit it after checking the zomato ratings. We were just so happy with the decision. We ordered for minestrone soup, baked brown rice with mixed veggies, chicken sausages and ice cream, we were just so satisfied with the food, specially the Rice. .would really visit again. Also the dark chocolate balls that they give in the end is just wow.'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED

  The place lives up to its 'Mediterraneaness'.
The place has very lively hues of blue pink and white which can vibe up your mood .
I thoroughly enjoyed the food they served. We had a genovese minestrone with pita bread. Also had sheesh kebabs which went amazingly with the spice marinade .
The Quatro stagioni pizza had for 4 elements and was flavoursome. They also had lots of options in pasta,burgers and rissotos.

In desserts ,their signature dish-the Orange was a feast for the eyes. It was layered creamy dish along with apricots and walnuts.

The one thing that was missing in the entire ensemble was alcohol. They only served beer and non alcoholic mocktails. Even their cocktails had a beer base . Hope they start serving the same soon."), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  Fava Bistro ,the Chef Abhijit SahaÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x92s culinary endeavour to great dining bistro style has finally arrived at Koramagla, the food district of Bangalore. With a relaxed seating , soothing ambience , and option to enjoy food outdoors with fresh breeze , watching the bake oven pizzas being prepared while sipping array of craft beers , is pure bliss. ...
Read full post on thefoodietales.com'), ('Rated 4.0', "RATED
  Well this place is 4.5 for me. Totally loved the simplicity and elegance of the ambiance. This is a place where one can simply spend hours together if they have people to talk to. A wide range in the menu and everything that was served was of good quality, a reasonably good quantity and well presented. Most of the items in their menu are unique which adds to it's awesomeness. name: Podi Idly
reviews_list:
[('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Good Food with a hygiene maintained area. When ever i feel to have south Indian Food, either i visit this place or order online. It never disappointed me in terms of quality. My all time favorite is podi Idly and kothu paratha. Also they have some kerala delicacies. Do try their iddiyappam and appam with stew.

I will recommend this place.'), ('Rated 4.0', 'RATED
  Went here for breakfast on sunday when i was searching for a place to have podi idly, the outlet has normal sitting and has self service. I had podi idly here, idly and rava onion dosa. Everything was served with 3 kinds of chutney which were coconut chutney, tomato chutney and 1 more and sambhar. Everything was good specially the idlys are yummy here and podi idly is a must have. Rava onion dosa was ok ok. otherwise its an awesome place to have podi idly and idlys

foodtravelpedia.wordpress.com'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  The place has a very normal sitting but the food is amazing quality. Coffee is real good. Ghee masala dosa and Podi Idli are must try. Affordable food'), ('Rated 5.0', 'RATED
  One of the best place for breakfast, itÃ\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82ÃÂ¢Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x80Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x83Ã\x82Ã\x82Ã\x99s Tamil style tamarind sambar. You almost get all South Indian items to eat here.. they are great at fast delivery too. I visit this place often and I like there Podi masala Dosa and Podi idli. Best part is the way they serve three different chutney green oranagr and white .. Tiranaga chutney all tasty and absolutely consistent everyday.   The most amazing south indian place in koramangala... a small outlet near koramangala club... very very clean.. serves authentic tamilnadu style sambhar and chutney.. its fingerlicking good... must try its podi idli, ragi dosa, onion uttapam these are my personal favourite... i am sure you will revisit the place once you eat here...'), ('Rated 3.0', 'RATED
  Podi Idly is an honest hole in the wall style cafe which is tucked in a bustling Koramangala street, neighbor to Koramangala Club. It promises the best south indian tamil food at the cheapest prices.

This is my go to weekend joint and it never disappoints. Idlis are softest and podi idly just melts in your mouth. It is tempered right. The chutneys the serve with is to die for. Coconut chutney is fresh and simple. Onion tomato chutney is put of the world, sweet, sour and spicy.

Butter dosas are crispy and really nice. Podi Kal Dosa is nice and spongy and feels like hommade dosas.

They also serve morning tiffins, which are mix of idli, vada, upma, kesar bhat and coffee.

This is the best deal you can get out of your money. reviews_list: [('Rated 4.0', 'RATED\n  I tried the paneer fried rice and it was good. I had ordered for delivery and packing was excellent. The rice was neatly packed in a silver foil container and sauce was packed separately. Again a bigger box was used to pack these.')]
